instruction_text:
To handle software installation requests:

1. Verify request and requirements:
   - Confirm software name and version needed
   - Check business justification
   - Verify user has approval if required
   - Check license requirements

2. Check system compatibility:
   - Verify OS version compatibility
   - Check hardware requirements (RAM, disk space)
   - Verify architecture (32-bit vs 64-bit)
   - Check for conflicts with existing software

3. For Windows installations:
   - Use appropriate installer (MSI, EXE, MSIX)
   - Run installer as administrator if needed
   - Follow installation wizard
   - Choose installation location if required

4. Using PowerShell/Winget:
   - Winget: winget install --id PackageName
   - Chocolatey: choco install packagename
   - Verify package is trusted source

5. Silent/automated installation:
   - Use silent flags: /S, /quiet, /silent
   - Create installation script for multiple machines
   - Example: msiexec /i installer.msi /quiet /norestart

6. Network/remote installation:
   - Use deployment tools (SCCM, Group Policy)
   - Push via RMM tools
   - Remote desktop installation

7. Post-installation:
   - Verify installation completed successfully
   - Launch application and test basic functionality
   - Configure settings if needed
   - Add desktop shortcuts if requested

8. License activation:
   - Activate license if required
   - Register software if needed
   - Document license information

9. User notification:
   - Inform user installation is complete
   - Provide access instructions
   - Share license key if applicable

10. Documentation:
    - Document installation in asset management
    - Update software inventory
    - Note any special configuration
    - Record license information

11. For restricted software:
    - Check company software policy
    - Verify security compliance
    - Get approval from security team if needed
    - Consider alternatives if policy restricts
